born 11 January 1996) is a German professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Midfielder#Winger|winger]] and as an [[Midfielder#Attacking midfielder|attacking midfielder]] for {{English football updater|ManchesC}} club [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] and the [[Germany national football team|German national team]].
He made his professional debut for [[FC Schalke 04|Schalke 04]] in 2014 and transferred to Manchester City in 2016 for an initial £37 million fee. He was voted [[PFA Young Player of the Year]] in 2017–18 after helping City win the [[Premier League]] and [[EFL Cup]].
Sané made his senior international debut for Germany in November 2015 and was part of their squad that reached the semi-finals of [[UEFA Euro 2016]].
==Club career== ===Early career=== Sané began playing football in 2001 for the youth team of [[SG Wattenscheid 09]], for which his [[Souleyman Sané|father]] played early in his career. In 2005, he joined [[FC Schalke 04|Schalke 04]]. Three years later, he joined [[Bayer 04 Leverkusen|Bayer Leverkusen]]. In 2011, Sané returned to the youth academy (''Nachwuchsleistungszentrum'') of Schalke 04.
===Schalke 04=== On 21 March 2014, Sané signed a three-year professional contract with Schalke 04 extending until 30 June 2017.<ref name="Sane commits to Schalke">{{cite web |url=http://www.schalke04.de/en/news/140321_sane/page/827--86--.html |title=Sane commits to Schalke |publisher=FC Schalke 04 official website |date=21 March 2014 |accessdate=27 August 2014}}</ref> He made his [[Bundesliga]] debut on 20 April 2014 against [[VfB Stuttgart]].<ref name="VfB Stuttgart vs. Schalke 04 at Soccerway"/> He replaced [[Max Meyer (footballer)|Max Meyer]] after 77 minutes in a 3–1 away defeat.<ref name="VfB Stuttgart vs. Schalke 04 at Soccerway">{{cite web |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2014/04/20/germany/bundesliga/vfb-stuttgart-1893-ev/fc-schalke-04/1487295/ |title=Stuttgart vs. Schalke 04 3 – 1 |publisher=Soccerway |date=20 April 2014 |accessdate=5 August 2015}}</ref> He scored his first goal of the [[2014–15 FC Schalke 04 season|season]] in a 2–1 home defeat to [[1. FC Köln]] on 13 December.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bundesliga.com/en/news/Bundesliga/blmd12v-ten-things-about-leroy-sane-fc-schalke-04.jsp |title=Ten things about Leroy Sané |publisher=Bundesliga |accessdate=17 August 2018}}</ref> On 11 March 2015, Sané scored in his first [[UEFA Champions League]] match in a 4–3 victory over [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]], although his side were knocked out of the [[2014–15 UEFA Champions League|competition]] on 5–4 aggregate.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/mar/10/real-madrid-schalke-champions-league-match-report |title=Real Madrid made to sweat by never-say-die Schalke but shock averted |publisher=The Guardian |accessdate=17 August 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/31802502 |title=Real Madrid 3–4 Schalke (5–4 agg) |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=17 August 2018}}</ref>
===Manchester City===
====2016–17 season==== [[File:Manchester United v Manchester City, October 2016 (18).JPG|left|thumb|upright|Sané playing for [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] during the [[Manchester derby]] in October 2016.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37700029 |title=Manchester United 1–0 Manchester City |date=26 October 2016 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 September 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref>]] On 2 August 2016, Sané joined [[Premier League]] club [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]], signing a five-year contract for a reported £37 million transfer fee, with performance-related add-ons potentially making the fee £46.5 million.<ref name="Sane completes transfer to City">{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/36950347 |title=Leroy Sane: Germany midfielder joins Man City in £37m deal |publisher=BBC Sport |date=2 August 2016 |accessdate=2 August 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.espnfc.com/story/2920739/manchester-city-complete-signing-of-leroy-sane-from-schalke |title=Manchester City complete signing of Leroy Sane from Schalke |publisher=ESPN FC |date=2 August 2016 |accessdate=2 August 2016}}</ref> He made his debut in a 1–2 win, in the [[Manchester derby]] against [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]], on 10 September.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/sep/10/manchester-united-manchester-city-premier-league-match-report |title=Manchester City's derby delight as De Bruyne inspires win over United |work=The Guardian |accessdate=18 September 2016}}</ref> His first goal for City came in a 2–1 win against [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] at home in the Premier League, on 18 December.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38279282 |title=Manchester City 2–1 Arsenal |publisher=BBC Sport |date=18 December 2016 |accessdate=28 January 2017}}</ref> Following a spell on the sidelines due to injury, Sané made his return in a game against [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] and scored in a 2–2 draw at the [[City of Manchester Stadium]] on 21 January 2017.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38620041 |title=Manchester City 2–2 Tottenham Hotspur |publisher=BBC Sport |date=21 January 2017 |accessdate=28 January 2017}}</ref> On 28 January, he scored in a 3–0 away win over Crystal Palace in the [[2016–17 FA Cup|FA Cup]] [[2016–17 FA Cup#Fourth Round Proper|fourth round]] match.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/38700695 |title=Crystal Palace 0–3 Manchester City |date=2017 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 September 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref> On 21 February, he scored in a 5–3 comeback win over [[AS Monaco FC|Monaco]] in the [[2016–17 UEFA Champions League|UEFA Champions League]] [[2016–17 UEFA Champions League#Round of 16|round of sixteen]] [[2016–17 UEFA Champions League knockout phase#Manchester City v Monaco|first leg match]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/39030973 |title=Manchester City 5–3 Monaco |date=21 February 2017 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 September 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref> On 1 March, he scored in a 5–1 home win over Huddersfield Town in the [[2016–17 FA Cup|FA Cup]] [[2016–17 FA Cup#Fifth Round Proper|fifth round]] replay match.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/39035253 |title=Manchester City 5–1 Huddersfield Town |date=1 March 2017 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 September 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref> Four days later, on 5 March, he scored in a 2–0 away win over Sunderland.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/live/football/38604372 |title=Aguero and Sane see off Sunderland |date=27 February 2017 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 September 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref> On 15 March, he scored in the [[2016–17 UEFA Champions League knockout phase#Monaco v Manchester City|return fixture]] of the [[2016–17 UEFA Champions League|UEFA Champions League]] match against [[AS Monaco FC|Monaco]], but City lost 1–3, knocking them out from the tournament on the [[away goals rule]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/39248906 |title=Monaco 3–1 Manchester City |date=15 March 2017 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 September 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref> On 2 April, he scored the opening goal in an eventual 2–2 draw with Arsenal.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/39396482 |title=Arsenal 2–2 Manchester City |date=2 April 2017 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 September 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref> On 15 April, he scored in a 3–0 win over [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/39536675 |title=Southampton 0–3 Manchester City |date=15 April 2017 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 September 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref>
In July 2017, Sané revealed he believed his debut season at City had been limited by his inability to breathe through his nose.<ref name=":0" /> He said he particularly suffered during matches, with his constantly blocked nose hampering his performance and causing him intense frustration.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/leroy-sane-manchester-city-nose-10875407 |title=Leroy Sane gets a nose job as he looks to get Man City career back on track |last=Association |first=Press |date=26 July 2017 |work=mirror|access-date=5 February 2018}}</ref> He opted to have corrective surgery during the off-season break. Although this caused him to miss that year's [[2017 FIFA Confederations Cup|FIFA Confederations Cup]], he said his chronic nasal congestion was becoming increasingly unbearable for him and that he wished to enter the next season feeling happy and healthy.<ref name=":0">{{Cite news |url=https://talksport.com/football/nose-surgery-rules-manchester-city-and-germany-winger-leroy-sane-out-2017-confederations |title=Nose surgery rules Manchester City and Germany winger Leroy Sane out of 2017 Confederations Cup |last=talkSPORT |date=23 May 2017 |work=talkSPORT|access-date=5 February 2018 |language=en}}</ref>
====2017–18 season==== [[File:Leroy Sané in December 2017 (cropped).jpg|thumb|upright|Sané playing during the [[Manchester derby]] in December 2017.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/42212593 |title=Manchester United 1–2 Manchester City |date=10 December 2017 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 September 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref>]] On 9 September 2017, Sané scored his first two goals of the [[2017–18 Manchester City F.C. season|2017–18 season]] in City's 5–0 home win against [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/sep/09/manchester-city-liverpool-premier-league-match-report |title=Manchester City and Gabriel Jesus hammer 10-man Liverpool 5–0 |date=9 September 2017 |work=The Guardian}}</ref> On 20 September, he scored twice in a 2–1 away win over [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] in the [[2017–18 EFL Cup#Third round|third round match]] of the [[2017–18 EFL Cup|League Cup]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/41249726 |title=West Bromwich Albion 1–2 Manchester City |date=20 September 2017 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 September 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref> On 23 September, he scored in a 5–0 win over [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41290318 |title=Manchester City 5–0 Crystal Palace |date=23 September 2017 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 September 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref> On 14 October, he scored in a 7–2 win over [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/41534300 |title=Manchester City 7–2 Stoke City |date=14 October 2017 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 September 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref> On 21 October, he scored in a 3–0 win over [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41618798 |title=Manchester City 3–0 Burnley |date=21 October 2017 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 September 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref> On 28 October, he scored in a 3–2 away win over [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/41703865 |title=West Bromwich Albion 2–3 Manchester City |date=28 October 2017 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 September 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref> After scoring and assisting once in each of his three matches, he earned the [[Premier League Player of the Month]] award for October 2017.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/512728 |title=Sane wins EA SPORTS Player of the Month award|access-date=19 December 2017 |language=en}}</ref> On 6 January 2018, he scored in a 4–1 win in the [[2017–18 FA Cup|FA Cup]] [[2017–18 FA Cup#Third Round Proper|third round]] over Burnley.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/42519596 |title=Manchester City 4–1 Burnley |date=2018 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 September 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref> On 14 January, he scored in a 4–3 defeat to Liverpool.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/42594403 |title=Liverpool 4–3 Manchester City |date=2018 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 September 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref> Nine days later, on 23 January, he scored in a 3–2 away win over Bristol City, securing advancement into the [[2018 EFL Cup Final|League Cup final]], in which he played 77 minutes before being substituted off as City won 3–0 over [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] to clinch their first trophy under [[Pep Guardiola]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/42698924 |title=Bristol City 2–3 Manchester City (Agg: 3–5) |date=2018 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 September 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/43101681 |title=Arsenal 0–3 Manchester City |date=25 February 2018 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 September 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref> On 1 March, five days following the win in the final, he scored against Arsenal in a 3–0 league away win.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/43150331 |title=Arsenal 0–3 Manchester City |date=2 March 2018 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 September 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref> On 31 March, he scored in a 3–1 away win over Everton, putting City just a win away from winning the league title.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/43524315 |title=Everton 1–3 Manchester City |date=31 March 2018 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 September 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref> On 29 April, he scored in a 4–1 away win over West Ham United.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/43854105 |title=West Ham United 1–4 Manchester City |date=29 April 2018 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 September 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref>
Sané was voted the [[PFA Young Player of the Year]] for his part in Manchester City's [[2017–18 Premier League]] title win, edging teammates [[Raheem Sterling]] and [[Ederson Moraes|Ederson]], as well as [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]]'s [[Harry Kane]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/949689/PFA-Young-Player-of-the-Year-shortlist-awards-sportgalleries |title=PFA Young Player of the Year: Full shortlist ahead of tonight's awards |last=Potts |first=Michael |date=22 April 2018 |work=Express.co.uk|access-date=26 April 2018 |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.espn.com/soccer/manchester-city/story/3466866/manchester-citys-leroy-sane-named-pfa-young-player-of-the-year |title=Sane named PFA Young Player of the Year |work=ESPN.com|access-date=26 April 2018}}</ref><ref name="PFA">{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43860354 |title=PFA Player of the Year 2017–18: Liverpool's Mohamed Salah wins top award |date=23 April 2018 |accessdate=23 April 2018 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> With [[2017–18 Premier League#Top assists|15 assists]], Sané just missed out on winning the inaugural [[Premier League Playmaker of the Season]] award to fellow teammate [[Kevin De Bruyne]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/690283|title=De Bruyne edges Playmaker award|website=www.premierleague.com|language=en|date=14 May 2018}}</ref>
====2018–19 season==== On 15 September 2018, Sané scored the opening goal and his first of the [[2018–19 Manchester City F.C. season|2018–19 season]] in City's 3–0 home win against [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45456654|title=Manchester City 3–0 Fulham|publisher=BBC Sport|date=15 September 2018|accessdate=29 November 2018}}</ref> He later scored the final goal in consecutive home match wins over Burnley and Southampton.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45847417|title=Manchester City 5–0 Burnley|publisher=BBC Sport|date=20 October 2018|accessdate=29 November 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46007194|title=Manchester City 6–1 Southampton|publisher=BBC Sport|date=4 November 2018|accessdate=29 November 2018}}</ref> On 24 November, Sané assisted a first-half goal for Sterling and scored a brace in a 4–0 away win over West Ham United.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45456654|title=West Ham 0–4 Manchester City|publisher=BBC Sport|date=15 September 2018|accessdate=29 November 2018}}</ref>
On 3 January 2019, he scored the winning goal for [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] in the 72nd minute of the game against [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]], which resulted in Liverpool's unbeaten run in the [[English Premier league|English Premier League]] coming to an end.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/man-city-liverpool-result-match-report-sergio-aguero-goal-a8710436.html|title=Leroy Sane’s pinpoint finish ends Liverpool’s unbeaten run to reignite title race|date=2019-01-03|website=The Independent|language=en|access-date=2019-01-05}}</ref>
==International career== Sané was first called up to the [[Germany national under-21 football team|Germany under-21 team]] by youth coach [[Horst Hrubesch]] on 28 August 2015 for the friendly against Denmark and for the [[2017 UEFA European Under-21 Championship]] qualifier against [[Azerbaijan national under-21 football team|Azerbaijan]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/u21/startseite/633965/artikel_brandt-26-co-_hrubesch-holt-17-neue.html#omsearchresult |title=Brandt & Co.: Hrubesch holt 17 Neue |author= |work=kicker online |publisher=Olympia Verlag GmbH |date=28 August 2015 |accessdate=22 November 2015 |language=de}}</ref> On 3 September 2015, he made his debut for the German U21 side in a 2–1 win at [[Stadion an der Lohmühle]] in [[Lübeck]] against [[Denmark national under-21 football team|Denmark]], where he was replaced after 73 minutes by [[Julian Brandt]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/intligen/intwettbewerbe/u-21-nationalteams-freundschaftsspiele/2015/1/2839788/spielanalyse_deutschland-3096_daenemark-u-21.html#omsearchresult |title=Sieg trotz Rückstand: DFB-Elf zeigt Moral |author= |work=kicker online |publisher=Olympia Verlag GmbH |date=3 September 2015 |accessdate=22 November 2015 |language=de}}</ref> [[File:20161011 U21 AUT GER 9584.jpg|left|thumb|upright|Sané playing for the Germany youth side in October 2016.]] Sané received his first senior call-up to the [[Germany national football team|German senior team]] on 6 November 2015 in a friendly against [[France national football team|France]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.dw.com/en/gomez-returns-trapp-and-sané-selected/a-18833110 |title=Gomez returns, Trapp and Sané selected |work=Deutsche Welle |date=6 November 2015 |accessdate=12 November 2015}}</ref> On 13 November 2015, he was substituted in the 61st-minute for [[Julian Draxler]] in a friendly match against France in [[Stade de France|Saint-Denis]], in what would be a 2–0 defeat for the Germans, overshadowed by [[November 2015 Paris attacks|shootings and explosions around the stadium]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/nationalelf/startseite/fussball-nationalteams-freundschaftsspiele/2015/6/2856069/spielbericht_frankreich_deutschland.html |title=Frankreichs Sieg verkommt zur Fußnote |author= |work=kicker online |publisher=Olympia Verlag GmbH |date=13 November 2015 |accessdate=22 November 2015 |language=de}}</ref>
Sané was selected by Germany boss [[Joachim Löw]] to represent the country at [[UEFA Euro 2016]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro-finals/season=2016/teams/team=47/squad/index.html |title=UEFA EURO 2016 – Germany – Squad |work=UEFA.com |accessdate=6 December 2016}}</ref> He participated in one match, replacing [[Bastian Schweinsteiger]] on 79 minutes in Germany's 2–0 semi-final defeat to [[France national football team|France]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36669829 |title=Germany 0–2 France |work=BBC Sport |date=7 July 2016 |accessdate=6 December 2016}}</ref>
Sané was eligible to play for France because he holds [[French nationality law|French citizenship]].<ref name=":1">{{Cite news |url=https://www.bailiwickexpress.com/jsy/life/sport-xtra/5-things-you-need-know-about-manchester-city-target-leroy-sane/ |title=5 things you need to know about Manchester City target Leroy Sane |last=Express |first=Bailiwick |work=Bailiwick Express|access-date=26 March 2018 |language=en}}</ref>
Sané was omitted from Germany's final 23-man squad for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] on 4 June 2018.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.dw.com/en/germany-announce-final-world-cup-squad-with-manuel-neuer-without-leroy-san%C3%A9/a-44064011 |title=Germany announce final World Cup squad, with Manuel Neuer, without Leroy Sané |publisher=Deutsche Welle |accessdate=4 June 2018}}</ref> In September 2018, after he was selected for the squad to face games against France and Peru, he left the team hotel after a discussion with [[Joachim Löw]], citing "personal reasons" as his cause for leaving.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/45452552 |title=Leroy Sane: Man City winger leaves Germany team hotel after talks with Joachim Low |date=7 September 2018 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 September 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref> It was later revealed that the reason for leaving was due to the birth of his daughter.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/45452552 |title=Leroy Sane: Man City winger announces birth of daughter after leaving Germany team hotel |date=8 September 2018 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=8 September 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |url=https://twitter.com/LeroySane19/status/1038393386821210112 |title=Leroy Sané on Twitter |work=Twitter|access-date=8 September 2018 |language=en}}</ref>
On 16 November 2018 he scored his first goal for [[Germany national football team|Germany]] against [[Russia national football team|Russia]] following an assist from [[Serge Gnabry]]. The goal came in the 8 th minute of the game as Germans won the game by 3-0.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.goal.com/en-ar/news/18722/main/2018/11/16/49389132/germany-3-russia-0-sane-on-target-as-lows-men-stroll |title=International friendly: Germany 3 Russia 0 {{!}} Goal.com|website=www.goal.com|language=en|access-date=2018-11-18}}</ref>
==Personal life== Sané is the son of former German [[Rhythmic gymnastics|rhythmic gymnast]], the [[1984 Summer Olympics]] bronze medalist [[Regina Weber]] and former footballer and [[Senegal national football team|Senegalese international]] [[Souleyman Sané|Souleymane Sané]].<ref name="Sane commits to Schalke" /><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11887/9231944/transfer-news-schalke-reward-academy-star-leroy-sane-with-two-year-deal |title=Schalke reward academy star Leroy Sane with two-year deal |author=Zocher, Thomas |publisher=Sky Sports |date=25 March 2014 |accessdate=26 April 2014}}</ref> Souleymane Sané was raised in France; he moved to Germany through his service in the [[French Army]]. Leroy Sané was born in [[Essen]], [[North Rhine-Westphalia]], and raised near the [[Lohrheidestadion]], [[Wattenscheid]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.westline.de/fussball/schalke04/Leroy-Sane-Nicht-einfach-zwischen-den-Welten-zu-switchen%3Bart2009,2278266 |title=Leroy Sane: Nicht einfach zwischen den Welten zu switchen |author=Philipp Rentsch |work=westline |publisher=westline GbR: Aschendorff Medien GmbH & Co. KG und WestOnline GmbH & Co. KG in Gesellschaft bürgerlichen Rechts |date=26 May 2015 |accessdate=26 August 2015 |language=de}}</ref> He was named Leroy in honor of [[Claude Le Roy]], a former head coach of his father.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Allemagne-leroy-sane-schalke-04-aurait-il-pu-jouer-pour-l-equipe-de-france/606705 |title=Allemagne : Leroy Sané (Schalke 04) aurait-il pu jouer pour l'équipe de France ? |author=Hugues Sionis |publisher=L'Équipe |date=12 November 2015 |accessdate=12 November 2015 |language=fr}}</ref> He has [[Multiple citizenship|dual]] [[German nationality law|German]] and [[French nationality law|French]] citizenship.<ref name=":1" /><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.eurosport.de/fussball/testspiel/2015/leroy-sane-eine-chance-fur-den-senkrechtstarter_sto4986250/story.shtml |title=Senkrechtstarter Leroy Sané: Eine Chance in der deutschen Nationalmannschaft |author=Fabian Kunze |publisher=Eurosport |date=11 November 2015 |accessdate=14 November 2015 |language=de}}</ref>
